problem_prompt:
Your job is to consider a number theory problem, and leave a plan for the next person to solve it. The problem will be revealed one sentence at a time. You do not have the entire problem yet, thus just do whatever calcluations/planning you think will be useful for the next person. If you don't think you can make any progress, say so. The following is a portion of the entire problem, and the work/progress/message the previous person left for you. There may be errors in the provided work that was previously done and left for you, so check and fix them if necessary.
Find the product of $10101_2$ and $101_2$.
solution:
Carry out the multiplication as you would with base $10$. There is no need to carry during the multiplication with base $2$.

$$\begin{array}{c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c} &&&&1&0&1&0&1_2\\ &&&&&\times&1&0&1_2\\ \cline{2-9} &&&_1&1^{\text{ }}&0^1&1^{\text{ }}&0^{\text{ }}&1^{\text{ }}_2\\ &+&1^{\text{ }}&0^{\text{ }}&1&0_{\text{ }}&1&0&0_2\\ \cline{2-9} &&1&1&0&1&0&0&1_2\\ \end{array}$$Add it up for a final answer of $\boxed{1101001_2}$.
gpt_response:
Previous work: 
$10101_2 \times 101_2$.
Convert the binary numbers to decimal to make the multiplication easier: $10101_2 = 21$ and $101_2 = 5$. 

Next step: Multiply $21$ and $5$ to find the product.
